intro: Kuruna densifolia, commonly known as the dense-leaved kuruna, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically leathery and arranged oppositely along the stems. Kuruna densifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
